articles.description: The study showed that supplying electric current to purple phototrophic bacteria can recover nearly 100 per cent of carbon from any type of organic waste, while generating hydrogen gas for electricity production
articles.content: London: A purple bacteria -- which store energy from light -- can help harvest hydrogen fuel from sewage, and recover carbon from any type of organic waste, scientists have found. Organic compounds i… [+2688 chars]

articles.title: ‘Indians are so good at mathematics and physics’: When Stephen Hawking came to India - Hindustan Times
articles.description: Scientist Stephen Hawking made a 16-day trip to India in 2001, visiting Mumbai and New Delhi. During the visit, he met then president KR Narayanan.
articles.content:
It was January 2001 when British physicist Stephen Hawking came to India for the first time, later describing the 16-day long tour as magnificent.

articles.title: Nothing existed before Big Bang: Stephen Hawking - Hindustan Times
articles.description: The Big Bang theory proposes that a tiny speck of matter and energy began to grow, bringing about the birth of our universe about the universe billions of years ago.
articles.content:
